Yam is the common name for some plant species in the genus Dioscorea (family 
Dioscoreaceae) that form edible tubers. Yams are perennial herbaceous vines 
cultivated for the consumption of their starchy tubers in Africa, Asia, Latin America
, the Caribbean, and Oceania. The tubers themselves are also called "yams". ...
